Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Adjusted Donor Lung Weight on Primary Graft Dysfunction in Lung Transplantation

Participants.evidence: 194 bilateral lung transplantations were performed at Sahlgrenska University Hospital, Sweden, from January 2014 to May 2021

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the relationship between adjusted donor lung weight and PGD outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of PGD (grades II and III) within 72 hours post-transplant.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the retrospective design.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the retrospective design.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The incidence of PGD was significantly higher in the "high-weight" group (22.9%) compared to the "low-weight" group (8.9%) (p = 0.020).

Funding.evidence: Supported by Sahlgrenska University Hospital foundations, The Gothenburg Society of Medicine, and the Swedish Heart-Lung Foundation.
